title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Domaine des Coteaux de la Ronze  (Beaujolais)
description: From one of the estates that Duboeuf bottles separately, the wine is fruity and soft. It has attractive red fruits and light, well-integrated tannins. A touch of cherry pepper character gives it a lift. Drink now.
designation: Domaine des Coteaux de la Ronze

title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Red (Alentejano)
description: This fruity red wine is one of Portugal's best sellers. Along with its red fruit and attractive acidity it is soft with just an edge of tannins. Drink this young wine now.

title: Ignacio Marín 2012 Ballad Old Vine Garnacha (Cariñena)
description: Lightly green aromas of herbal red plum and cinnamon lead to a hard, closed, edgy palate. Minimal red-fruit flavors are herbal and finish scratchy, tannic and raw.

title: Kourtaki NV Retsina of Attica Savatiano (Attica)
description: Crushed thyme, pine resin and lemon start this traditional retsina from Attica. On the palate, an interplay of herbs and citrus offer good balance, a soft finish and an easy entrée into a sometimes difficult style of Greek wine, The price is right too; try this with fried fish.

title: Zinfandelic 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Strikingly fresh blueberry and blackberry flavors light up this dry, medium-bodied wine.Relatively light on the palate, it's leaner than most of its peers.

title: Terralsole 2012  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Scorched earth, dry underbrush and chopped aromatic herb aromas lift out of the glass. The lean palate is rather evolved, showing dried cherry, espresso and a hint of anise alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Cousiño-Macul 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Maule Valley)
description: Mild aromas of lime, peach and white flowers sit in front of a tight but simple palate. Slightly tart lemon, orange and pineapple flavors finish lean, with freshness but also some scour.

title: Cuvee Los Gatos 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A fairly interesting though somewhat curious array of aromas arise off of this lower-priced bottling by the Testarossa crew, showing passionfruit macaron, struck match, shaved sandalwood and roast-chicken aromas. The woody character carries to the palate, where oak flavors meets with dried apple, dried pear and dried white flowers.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2015 Ciconia Rosé (Alentejano)
description: With a predominance of the smooth Aragaonez, this is a wine that is both crisp and soft. It is crisp with acidity and soft with ripe red berry fruits. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Tarambola Red (Lisboa)
description: This is a ripe, perfumed wine, smooth from light oak aging and fruity with the black currant flavors. It has attractive acidity and a juicy, spicy finish. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Cabo da Roca Red (Douro)
description: Firm and structured, the wine shows the mineral side of the Douro as well as ripe berry fruits. Shot through with juicy acidity as well as the fruit, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de Gry-Sablon 2015 Emeringes  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: The name of the cuvée refers to the name of the village where the domaine is situated. It is a blend of different parcels, the result being a crisp, fresh wine with bitter red-currant and spice flavors. It is ready to drink.

title: Château du Cèdre 2014 Cèdre Héritage Malbec (Cahors)
description: A fruity wine that is made to drink young. It has crunchy black-currant fruits that are cut with acidity, soft tannins and a juicy aftertaste. Drink this wine from 2017.

title: Château Los Boldos 2014 Grand Reserve Carmenère (Cachapoal Valley)
description: Spicy, leafy plum and earth notes make for a good nose. This is light in body but high in acid. Rooty, earthy plum flavors mimic the wine's core scents, while acidity lingers on the finish.

title: Callaway 2012 Wild Yeast Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: This wine's nose impresses, with dried dill, black cherry, black currant and touches of crushed gravel and dried tobacco. The palate is lively at first, until strong acidity takes the bottling into an extremely tart direction.

title: Calmel & Joseph 2015 Villa Blanche Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Bright and fruity, this opens with attractive aromas of strawberry and red cherry that are accented by hints of cola spice, foliage and orange oil. Medium yet fine-grained tannins provide a subtle structure to the palate, while flavors of cocoa-dusted cherry and plum flesh linger on the close.

title: Albet I Noya 2011 Brut Natural Reserva Sparkling (Penedès)
description: Bready and yeasty smelling upfront, this feels round but also dry on the palate. Briny, pickled, yeasty flavors lead way to a salty finish. Quickly dissipating bubbles render it more of a demi-sec.

title: Altesino 2014  Rosso di Montalcino
description: Forest floor, aromatic herb, moist soil and blue flower aromas take the lead. The simple, light-bodied palate starts off with juicy sour cherry, a hint of clove and a green note of sage, but it falls apart quickly, leaving brisk acidity fleeting tannins.

title: Aresti 2014 Special Release Reserva Pinot Noir (Curicó Valley)
description: Herbal aromas of cherry and currant are a touch grassy. This feels lean, racy and fresh, with spicy plum, berry and tomato flavors. Toasty oak notes rise up on the finish, which shows a note of chocolate as well as some heat.

title: Black Stallion 2015 Limited Release Rosé of Syrah (Oak Knoll District)
description: Made in a relatively full-bodied style, this concentrated wine is moderate in acidity, opting for full-flavored fruitiness happy in plum and raspberry.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Beyra Branco Colheita White (Beira Interior)
description: A blend of two local grapes, Síria and Fonte Cal, this is crisp, herbal and lightly textured. Lemon and grapefruit dominate the final acidity. Drink now.

title: Paul Mas 2015 Estate Single Vineyard Collection Saint Hilaire Vineyard Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Sourced from a vineyard near Limoux, this Pinot leads with aromas of red cherry, raspberry leaf and a touch of blackberry. The mouthfeel is light and accessible, with soft tannins and berrylicious flavors that dominate the palate.
designation: Estate Single Vineyard Collection Saint Hilaire Vineyard

title: Eximius NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: This smells like rosé Cava should: orange and a puff of smoke make up the nose. Pulpy and citrusy on the palate, this delivers midlevel grapefruit and orange flavors before falling off some on the finish.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2015 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)
description: Soft, ripe and fruity, this is an immediately attractive wine. Melon, pear and apricots come together in a fruit cocktail of a lively, crisp texture. Drink now.

title: François Baur 2015 Herrenweg Riesling (Alsace)
description: A very subdued nose leads to a lemon-flavored palate. The fruit notes are a little diffuse and lack focus, but the finish is dry and refreshing.

title: Domaine du Penlois 2015 Plaisir Estival  (Beaujolais-Villages)
description: The wine is called “summer pleasure” and its fruitiness and crisp texture seem well-suited. Red cherries, strawberries and a fine line of acidity set the scene for this soft fruity wine. Drink now.

title: Domaine Duperray 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Beaujolais)
description: This is a ripe wine, full of cherry fruit and bright acidity. It has a dry edge that gives the wine a structure to balance the crisp, perfumed fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Domaine Sainte-Eugénie 2015 Rosé (Corbières)
description: Muddled strawberry and watermelon aromas and flavors are partnered with an earthy streak reminiscent of wet leaves. The palate is similarly fruit forward, with ample acidity that lifts the fruity richness and results in a short but clean finish.

title: Arnaud de Villeneuve 2015 Rosé (Côtes Catalanes)
description: This salmon-colored rosé opens with pleasantly fruity aromas of tangerine, pineapple, papaya and honeydew. The palate, however, offers sharp and astringent notes of peach and apricot skin that lend a bitterness to the medium-length finish.

title: Arrogant Frog 2015 Lily Pad Pink Rosé (Pays d'Oc)
description: This is a straightforward but easy-to-enjoy selection, boasting upfront aromas and flavors of peach, watermelon rind and white currant. Light weight and bright in mouthwatering acidity, a hint of fresh-cut grass graces the clean finish.
